newsitem.title: USA: McDonald's makes Dominican Republic debut.
newsitem.headline: McDonald's makes Dominican Republic debut.

text.p: McDonald's Corp. said Monday it opened its first restaurant in the Dominican Republic on Saturday, expanding its fast-food network to 99 countries.
It was the third new country for the fast-food chain in a month, after Jordan and Paraguay.

"We're on target with our growth strategy around the world," said Jim Cantalupo, president of McDonald's International, "And we will cap a year of unprecedented international development with our 100th country milestone on Dec. 10."
In the last five years, the number of McDonald's restaurants in Latin America and the Caribbean has more than tripled, to over 650 restaurants. McDonald's has more than 20,000 outlets worldwide.
Oak Brook, Ill.-based McDonald's stock fell 87.5 cents to $45.875 on the New York Stock Exchange in afternoon trading.
